intro: Hibbertia mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red or orange markings. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Hibbertia mucronata is often found in heathlands and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor environments.
